intro: Dasymaschalon echinatum, commonly known as the spiny dasymaschalon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
